sentences.zh: 王者制事立法，物度軌則，壹稟於六律，六律為萬事根本焉。

translations.text: Kings establish affairs and create laws, measure things and set standards, all derive from the six pitch pipes; the six pitch pipes are the root of all matters.
Kings establish affairs and create laws, measure things and set standards, all derive from the six pitch pipes; the six pitch pipes are the root of all matters.

sentences.zh: 其於兵械尤所重，故云「望敵知吉凶，聞聲效勝負」，百王不易之道也。

translations.text: They especially value them for military weapons, hence it is said 'gaze at the enemy to know good and ill fortune, hear the sound to verify victory and defeat'—this is the unchanging way of a hundred kings.

They especially value them for military weapons, hence it is said 'gaze at the enemy to know good and ill fortune, hear the sound to verify victory and defeat'—this is the unchanging way of a hundred kings.

sentences.zh: 武王伐紂，吹律聽聲，推孟春以至于季冬，殺氣相并，而音尚宮。

translations.text: King Wu attacked Zhou, blew the pitch pipes and listened to the sounds, calculated from the first month of spring to the last month of winter, murderous qi gathered together, yet the sound still honored gong.

sentences.zh: 同聲相從，物之自然，何足怪哉？

translations.text: Like sounds follow each other, it is the natural way of things—what is there to be surprised about?

King Wu attacked Zhou, blew the pitch pipes and listened to the sounds, calculated from the first month of spring to the last month of winter, murderous qi gathered together, yet the sound still honored gong. Like sounds follow each other, it is the natural way of things—what is there to be surprised about?

sentences.zh: 兵者，聖人所以討彊暴，平亂世，夷險阻，救危殆。

translations.text: Soldiers are what sages use to punish the strong and violent, pacify chaotic ages, level dangerous passes, rescue perilous situations.

sentences.zh: 自含（血）［齒］戴角之獸見犯則校，而況於人懷好惡喜怒之氣？

translations.text: Even animals that contain teeth and wear horns fight when attacked, how much more so for people who harbor feelings of liking and disliking, joy and anger?

sentences.zh: 喜則愛心生，怒則毒螫加，情性之理也。

translations.text: When joyful then loving thoughts arise, when angry then poisonous stings are added—this is the principle of human nature and feelings.

Soldiers are what sages use to punish the strong and violent, pacify chaotic ages, level dangerous passes, rescue perilous situations. Even animals that contain teeth and wear horns fight when attacked, how much more so for people who harbor feelings of liking and disliking, joy and anger? When joyful then loving thoughts arise, when angry then poisonous stings are added—this is the principle of human nature and feelings.

sentences.zh: 昔黃帝有涿鹿之戰，以定火災；

translations.text: In ancient times the Yellow Emperor had the battle of Zhuolu, to settle the fire calamity;

sentences.zh: 顓頊有共工之陳，以平水害；

translations.text: Zhuanzu had the campaign against Gonggong, to pacify the water harm;

sentences.zh: 成湯有南巢之伐，以殄夏亂。

translations.text: King Cheng Tang had the campaign against Nan Nest, to exterminate the Xia disorder.

sentences.zh: 遞興遞廢，勝者用事，所受於天也。

translations.text: This was all using benevolent troops to right violence, great indeed!

In ancient times the Yellow Emperor had the battle of Zhuolu, to settle the fire calamity; Zhuanzu had the campaign against Gonggong, to pacify the water harm; King Cheng Tang had the campaign against Nan Nest, to exterminate the Xia disorder. This was all using benevolent troops to right violence, great indeed!

sentences.zh: 自是之後，名士迭興，晉用咎犯，而齊用王子，吳用孫武，申明軍約，賞罰必信，卒伯諸侯，兼列邦土，雖不及三代之誥誓，然身寵君尊，當世顯揚，可不謂榮焉？

translations.text: Those who use the Tao to nurture life, none do not take harmony as precious;

sentences.zh: 豈與世儒闇於大較，不權輕重，猥云德化，不當用兵，大至君辱失守，小乃侵犯削弱，遂執不移等哉！

translations.text: those who use virtue to transform the people, none do not take benevolence as the foundation.

sentences.zh: 笔教笞不可廢於家，刑罰不可捐於國，誅伐不可偃於天下，用之有巧拙，行之有逆順耳。

translations.text: The Tao of harmony, its achievement is in the pitch pipes;

Those who use the Tao to nurture life, none do not take harmony as precious; those who use virtue to transform the people, none do not take benevolence as the foundation. The Tao of harmony, its achievement is in the pitch pipes;

sentences.zh: 夏桀、殷紂手搏豺狼，足追四馬，勇非微也；

translations.text: the foundation of benevolence, its beginning is in the people.

sentences.zh: 百戰克勝，諸侯懾服，權非輕也。

translations.text: If the people are not benevolent, the state cannot be harmonious;

sentences.zh: 秦二世宿軍無用之地，連兵於邊陲，力非弱也；

translations.text: if the state is not harmonious, the pitch pipes cannot be correct.

sentences.zh: 結怨匈奴，絓禍於越，勢非寡也。

translations.text: Therefore the sage kings valued the pitch pipes and cherished the people.

sentences.zh: 及其威盡勢極，閭巷之人為敵國，咎生窮武之不知足，甘得之心不息也。

translations.text: The pitch pipes are the means by which to harmonize yin and yang, to adjust the four seasons, to make metal, wood, water, fire, earth not lose their proper order.

the foundation of benevolence, its beginning is in the people. If the people are not benevolent, the state cannot be harmonious; if the state is not harmonious, the pitch pipes cannot be correct. Therefore the sage kings valued the pitch pipes and cherished the people. The pitch pipes are the means by which to harmonize yin and yang, to adjust the four seasons, to make metal, wood, water, fire, earth not lose their proper order.

sentences.zh: 高祖有天下，三邊外畔；

translations.text: The people are the means by which to cultivate the five virtues, to accumulate the three goods, to make father and son not lose their proper relationship.

sentences.zh: 大國之王雖稱蕃輔，臣節未盡。

translations.text: If yin and yang are not harmonized, then wind and rain are not seasonal;

sentences.zh: 會高祖厭苦軍事，亦有蕭、張之謀，故偃武一休息，羈縻不備。

translations.text: if the four seasons are not adjusted, then cold and heat are not moderate;

The people are the means by which to cultivate the five virtues, to accumulate the three goods, to make father and son not lose their proper relationship. If yin and yang are not harmonized, then wind and rain are not seasonal; if the four seasons are not adjusted, then cold and heat are not moderate;

sentences.zh: 歷至孝文即位，將軍陳武等議曰：「南越、朝鮮自全秦時內屬為臣子，後且擁兵阻阸，選蠕觀望。

translations.text: if metal, wood, water, fire, earth lose their order, then the five grains do not grow.

sentences.zh: 高祖時天下新定，人民小安，未可復興兵。

translations.text: If the five virtues are not cultivated, then the six relations are not close;

sentences.zh: 今陛下仁惠撫百姓，恩澤加海內，宜及士民樂用，征討逆黨，以一封疆。」

translations.text: if the three goods are not accumulated, then the nine clans are not harmonious;

sentences.zh: 孝文曰：「朕能任衣冠，念不到此。

translations.text: if father and son lose their relationship, then the state and altars are imperiled.

sentences.zh: 會呂氏之亂，功臣宗室共不羞恥，誤居正位，常戰戰慄慄，恐事之不終。

translations.text: Therefore the sage kings established the pitch pipes to make manifest the Tao of heaven and earth, to illuminate the way of yin and yang.

sentences.zh: 且兵凶器，雖克所願，動亦秏病，謂百姓遠方何？

translations.text: They created the calendar to determine the succession of the four seasons, to fix the measures of length and capacity.

sentences.zh: 又先帝知勞民不可煩，故不以為意。

translations.text: They formulated the law to prohibit violence and punish robbery, to prevent evil and correct wrongdoing.

sentences.zh: 朕豈自謂能？

translations.text: They set up officials to oversee the hundred tasks, to assist and support the ruler.

sentences.zh: 今匈奴內侵，軍吏無功，邊民父子荷兵日久，朕常為動心傷痛，無日忘之。

translations.text: They cherished the people to fill the four seas, to make the altars of soil and grain secure.

sentences.zh: 今未能銷距，願且堅邊設候，結和通使，休寧北陲，為功多矣。

translations.text: They made music to harmonize the eight sounds, to unite the minds of superiors and inferiors.

sentences.zh: 且無議軍。」

translations.text: They established schools to teach the six arts, to propagate benevolence and righteousness.

sentences.zh: 故百姓無內外之繇，得息肩於田畝，天下殷富，粟至十餘錢，鳴雞吠狗，煙火萬里，可謂和樂者乎！

translations.text: They created punishments to restrain the strong and violent, to protect the weak and orphaned.

if metal, wood, water, fire, earth lose their order, then the five grains do not grow. If the five virtues are not cultivated, then the six relations are not close; if the three goods are not accumulated, then the nine clans are not harmonious; if father and son lose their relationship, then the state and altars are imperiled. Therefore the sage kings established the pitch pipes to make manifest the Tao of heaven and earth, to illuminate the way of yin and yang. They created the calendar to determine the succession of the four seasons, to fix the measures of length and capacity. They formulated the law to prohibit violence and punish robbery, to prevent evil and correct wrongdoing. They set up officials to oversee the hundred tasks, to assist and support the ruler. They cherished the people to fill the four seas, to make the altars of soil and grain secure. They made music to harmonize the eight sounds, to unite the minds of superiors and inferiors. They established schools to teach the six arts, to propagate benevolence and righteousness. They created punishments to restrain the strong and violent, to protect the weak and orphaned.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：文帝時，會天下新去湯火，人民樂業，因其欲然，能不擾亂，故百姓遂安。

translations.text: They constructed cities to gather the scattered people, to guard against harm from the four directions.

sentences.zh: 自年六七十翁亦未嘗至市井，游敖嬉戲如小兒狀。

translations.text: They opened roads to connect the nine provinces, to facilitate transport and communication.

sentences.zh: 孔子所稱有德君子者邪！

translations.text: They built palaces to distinguish noble and base, to make clear the hierarchy of ranks.

They constructed cities to gather the scattered people, to guard against harm from the four directions. They opened roads to connect the nine provinces, to facilitate transport and communication. They built palaces to distinguish noble and base, to make clear the hierarchy of ranks.

sentences.zh: 《書》曰［七正］，二十八舍。

translations.text: They made weapons to ward off violence and chaos, to ensure peace for the four quarters.

sentences.zh: 律歷，天所以通五行八正之氣，天所以成孰萬物也。

translations.text: All these hundred matters, none do not take the pitch pipes as their foundation.

sentences.zh: 舍者，日月所舍。

translations.text: The pitch pipes are born from the law of numbers;

sentences.zh: 舍者，舒氣也。

translations.text: the law of numbers is born from the Yellow Bell;

They made weapons to ward off violence and chaos, to ensure peace for the four quarters. All these hundred matters, none do not take the pitch pipes as their foundation. The pitch pipes are born from the law of numbers; the law of numbers is born from the Yellow Bell;

sentences.zh: 不周風居西北，主殺生。

translations.text: the Yellow Bell is born from the harmony of yin and yang;

sentences.zh: 東壁居不周風東，主辟生氣而東之。

translations.text: the harmony of yin and yang is born from the Tao of heaven and earth.

sentences.zh: 至於營室。

translations.text: Therefore it is called the great root of the world, the wonderful origin of all things.

sentences.zh: 營室者，主營胎陽氣而產之。

translations.text: The Yellow Emperor commanded Ling Lun to cut bamboo at the foot of Kunlun Mountain to make pitch pipes.

sentences.zh: 東至于危。

translations.text: Ling Lun blew them to imitate the sounds of the phoenix, and made twelve pitch pipes.

sentences.zh: 危，垝也。

translations.text: The male phoenix sings the yang sounds, the female phoenix sings the yin sounds.

sentences.zh: 言陽氣之（危）垝，故曰危。

translations.text: Ling Lun blew the yang sounds to make six pitch pipes, blew the yin sounds to make six pitch pipes, altogether twelve pitch pipes.

sentences.zh: 十月也，律中應鐘。

translations.text: He took the tube that sounded gong as the Yellow Bell, and used it to determine the twelve pitch pipes.

sentences.zh: 應鐘者，陽氣之應，不用事也。

translations.text: The Yellow Bell is the root of the twelve pitch pipes, the foundation of the six laws.

sentences.zh: 其於十二子為亥。

translations.text: Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to hai.

sentences.zh: 亥者，該也。

translations.text: Hai means 'to include'.

sentences.zh: 言陽氣藏於下，故該也。

translations.text: It says yang qi is hidden below, therefore it includes.

the Yellow Bell is born from the harmony of yin and yang; the harmony of yin and yang is born from the Tao of heaven and earth. Therefore it is called the great root of the world, the wonderful origin of all things. The Yellow Emperor commanded Ling Lun to cut bamboo at the foot of Kunlun Mountain to make pitch pipes. Ling Lun blew them to imitate the sounds of the phoenix, and made twelve pitch pipes. The male phoenix sings the yang sounds, the female phoenix sings the yin sounds. Ling Lun blew the yang sounds to make six pitch pipes, blew the yin sounds to make six pitch pipes, altogether twelve pitch pipes. He took the tube that sounded gong as the Yellow Bell, and used it to determine the twelve pitch pipes. The Yellow Bell is the root of the twelve pitch pipes, the foundation of the six laws. Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to hai. Hai means 'to include'. It says yang qi is hidden below, therefore it includes.

sentences.zh: 廣莫風居北方。

translations.text: The Guangmo wind resides in the north.

sentences.zh: 廣莫者，言陽氣在下，陰莫陽廣大也，故曰廣莫。

translations.text: Guangmo means yang qi is below, yin cannot reach the vast yang, therefore it is called Guangmo.

sentences.zh: 東至於虛。

translations.text: Eastward it reaches Xu.

sentences.zh: 虛者，能實能虛，言陽氣冬則宛藏於虛，日冬至則一陰下藏，一陽上舒，故曰虛。

translations.text: Xu means it can be full or empty, saying yang qi in winter curls and hides in emptiness; when winter solstice arrives, one yin hides below, one yang stretches above, therefore it is called Xu.

sentences.zh: 東至于須女。

translations.text: Eastward it reaches Xunu.

sentences.zh: 言萬物變動其所，陰陽氣未相離，尚相［如］胥［如］也，故曰須女。

translations.text: It says the ten thousand things change their places, yin and yang qi have not yet separated, still resemble each other like siblings, therefore it is called Xunu.

sentences.zh: 十一月也，律中黃鐘。

translations.text: Eleventh month, the pitch pipe resonates with Huangzhong.

sentences.zh: 黃鐘者，陽氣踵黃泉而出也。

translations.text: Huangzhong means yang qi follows the yellow springs and emerges.

sentences.zh: 其於十二子為子。

translations.text: Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to zi.

sentences.zh: 子者，滋也；

translations.text: Zi means 'to nourish';

sentences.zh: 滋者，言萬物滋於下也。

translations.text: nourish means the ten thousand things are nourished below.

sentences.zh: 其於十母為壬癸。

translations.text: Among the ten heavenly stems it corresponds to ren and gui.

sentences.zh: 壬之為言任也，言陽氣任養萬物於下也。

translations.text: Ren means 'to bear', saying yang qi bears and nurtures the ten thousand things below.

sentences.zh: 癸之為言揆也，言萬物可揆度，故曰癸。

translations.text: Gui means 'to measure', saying the ten thousand things can be measured, therefore it is called gui.

sentences.zh: 東至牽牛。

translations.text: Eastward it reaches Ox Leader.

sentences.zh: 牽牛者，言陽氣牽引萬物出之也。

translations.text: Ox Leader means yang qi pulls and leads the ten thousand things out.

sentences.zh: 牛者，冒也，言地雖凍，能冒而生也。

translations.text: Ox means 'to cover', saying although the earth is frozen, it can cover and give birth.

sentences.zh: 牛者，耕植種萬物也。

translations.text: Ox means to plow and plant, sowing the ten thousand things.

sentences.zh: 東至於建星。

translations.text: Eastward it reaches Jian Star.

sentences.zh: 建星者，建諸生也。

translations.text: Jian Star means to establish all living things.

sentences.zh: 十二月也，律中大呂。

translations.text: Twelfth month, the pitch pipe resonates with Dalü.

sentences.zh: 大呂者。

translations.text: Dalü means...

sentences.zh: 其於十二子為醜。

translations.text: Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to chou.

Xu means it can be full or empty, saying yang qi in winter curls and hides in emptiness; when winter solstice arrives, one yin hides below, one yang stretches above, therefore it is called Xu. Eastward it reaches Xunu. It says the ten thousand things change their places, yin and yang qi have not yet separated, still resemble each other like siblings, therefore it is called Xunu. Eleventh month, the pitch pipe resonates with Huangzhong. Huangzhong means yang qi follows the yellow springs and emerges. Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to zi. Ren means 'to bear', saying yang qi bears and nurtures the ten thousand things below. Gui means 'to measure', saying the ten thousand things can be measured, therefore it is called gui. Eastward it reaches Ox Leader. Ox Leader means yang qi pulls and leads the ten thousand things out. Ox means 'to cover', saying although the earth is frozen, it can cover and give birth. Ox means to plow and plant, sowing the ten thousand things. Eastward it reaches Jian Star. Jian Star means to establish all living things. Twelfth month, the pitch pipe resonates with Dalü. Dalü means... Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to chou.

sentences.zh: 條風居東北，主出萬物。

translations.text: The Tiao wind resides in the northeast, governs bringing forth the ten thousand things.

sentences.zh: 條之言條治萬物而出之，故曰條風。

translations.text: Tiao means to regulate and bring forth the ten thousand things, therefore it is called Tiao wind.

sentences.zh: 南至於箕。

translations.text: Southward it reaches Ji.

sentences.zh: 箕者，言萬物根棋，故曰箕。

translations.text: Ji means the roots of the ten thousand things gather together, therefore it is called Ji.

sentences.zh: 正月也，律中泰蔟。

translations.text: First month, the pitch pipe resonates with Taicu.

sentences.zh: 泰蔟者，言萬物蔟生也，故曰泰蔟。

translations.text: Taicu means the ten thousand things cluster and grow, therefore it is called Taicu.

sentences.zh: 其於十二子為寅。

translations.text: Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to yin.

sentences.zh: 寅言萬物始生螾然也，故曰寅。

translations.text: Yin says the ten thousand things begin to be born wriggling, therefore it is called yin.

sentences.zh: 南至於尾，言萬物始生如尾也。

translations.text: Southward it reaches Wei, saying the ten thousand things begin to be born like a tail.

sentences.zh: 南至於心，言萬物始生有華心也。

translations.text: Southward it reaches Xin, saying the ten thousand things begin to be born with flowery hearts.

sentences.zh: 南至於房。

translations.text: Southward it reaches Fang.

sentences.zh: 房者，言萬物門戶也，至于門則出矣。

translations.text: Fang means the gateway of the ten thousand things; when they reach the gate they emerge.

The Tiao wind resides in the northeast, governs bringing forth the ten thousand things. Tiao means to regulate and bring forth the ten thousand things, therefore it is called Tiao wind. Southward it reaches Ji. Ji means the roots of the ten thousand things gather together, therefore it is called Ji. First month, the pitch pipe resonates with Taicu. Taicu means the ten thousand things cluster and grow, therefore it is called Taicu. Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to yin. Yin says the ten thousand things begin to be born wriggling, therefore it is called yin. Southward it reaches Wei, saying the ten thousand things begin to be born like a tail. sentences.zh: 明庶風居東方。

translations.text: The Mingshu wind resides in the east.

sentences.zh: 明庶者，明眾物盡出也。

translations.text: Mingshu means all things clearly emerge.

sentences.zh: 二月也，律中夾鐘。

translations.text: Second month, the pitch pipe resonates with Jiazhong.

sentences.zh: 夾鐘者，言陰陽相夾廁也。

translations.text: Jiazhong means yin and yang intermix.

sentences.zh: 其於十二子為卯。

translations.text: Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to mao.

sentences.zh: 卯之為言茂也，言萬物茂也。

translations.text: Mao means 'luxuriant', saying the ten thousand things are luxuriant.

sentences.zh: 其於十母為甲乙。

translations.text: Among the ten heavenly stems it corresponds to jia and yi.

sentences.zh: 甲者，言萬物剖符甲而出也；

translations.text: Jia means the ten thousand things split their shells and emerge;

sentences.zh: 乙者，言萬物生軋軋也。

translations.text: yi means the ten thousand things grow crackling.

sentences.zh: 南至于氐者。

translations.text: Southward it reaches Di.

sentences.zh: 氐者，言萬物皆至也。

translations.text: Di means all things arrive.

sentences.zh: 南至於亢。

translations.text: Southward it reaches Kang.

sentences.zh: 亢者，言萬物亢見也。

translations.text: Kang means the ten thousand things appear strong.

sentences.zh: 南至于角。

translations.text: Southward it reaches Jiao.

sentences.zh: 角者，言萬物皆有枝格如角也。

translations.text: Jiao means all things have branches and frames like horns.

sentences.zh: 三月也，律中姑洗。

translations.text: Third month, the pitch pipe resonates with Gu Xi.

sentences.zh: 姑洗者，言萬物洗生。

translations.text: Gu Xi means the ten thousand things wash and grow.

sentences.zh: 其於十二子為辰。

translations.text: Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to chen.

sentences.zh: 辰者，言萬物之蜄也。

translations.text: Chen means the wriggling of the ten thousand things.

The Mingshu wind resides in the east. Mingshu means all things clearly emerge. Second month, the pitch pipe resonates with Jiazhong. Jiazhong means yin and yang intermix. Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to mao. Mao means 'luxuriant', saying the ten thousand things are luxuriant. Among the ten heavenly stems it corresponds to jia and yi. Jia means the ten thousand things split their shells and emerge; yi means the ten thousand things grow crackling. Southward it reaches Di. Di means all things arrive. Southward it reaches Kang. Kang means the ten thousand things appear strong. Southward it reaches Jiao. Jiao means all things have branches and frames like horns. Third month, the pitch pipe resonates with Gu Xi. Gu Xi means the ten thousand things wash and grow. Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to chen. Chen means the wriggling of the ten thousand things.

sentences.zh: 清明風居東南維，主風吹萬物而西之。

translations.text: The Qingming wind resides in the southeast corner, governs wind blowing the ten thousand things westward.

sentences.zh: ［至於］軫。

translations.text: Reaches Zhen.

sentences.zh: 軫者，言萬物益大而軫軫然。

translations.text: Zhen means the ten thousand things grow larger and are zhen zhen.

sentences.zh: 西至於翼。

translations.text: Westward it reaches Yi.

sentences.zh: 翼者，言萬物皆有羽翼也。

translations.text: Yi means all things have feathers and wings.

sentences.zh: 四月也，律中中呂。

translations.text: Fourth month, the pitch pipe resonates with Zhong Lü.

sentences.zh: 中呂者，言萬物盡旅而西行也。

translations.text: Zhong Lü means all things exhaust their journeys and travel west.

sentences.zh: 其於十二子為巳。

translations.text: Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to si.

sentences.zh: 巳者，言陽氣之已盡也。

translations.text: Si means yang qi has already been exhausted.

sentences.zh: 西至于七星。

translations.text: Westward it reaches Seven Stars.

sentences.zh: 七星者，陽數成於七，故曰七星。

translations.text: Seven Stars means yang number completes at seven, therefore called Seven Stars.

sentences.zh: 西至于張。

translations.text: Westward it reaches Zhang.

sentences.zh: 張者，言萬物皆張也。

translations.text: Zhang means all things are stretched out.

sentences.zh: 西至于注。

translations.text: Westward it reaches Zhu.

sentences.zh: 注者，言萬物之始衰，陽氣下注，故曰注。

translations.text: Zhu means the beginning decline of things, yang qi pours down, therefore called Zhu.

sentences.zh: 五月也，律中蕤賓。

translations.text: Fifth month, the pitch pipe resonates with Rui Bin.

sentences.zh: 蕤賓者，言陰氣幼少，故曰蕤；

translations.text: Rui Bin means yin qi is young and few, therefore called Rui;

sentences.zh: 痿陽不用事，故曰賓。

translations.text: yang is withered and does not function, therefore called Bin.

The Qingming wind resides in the southeast corner, governs wind blowing the ten thousand things westward. Reaches Zhen. Zhen means the ten thousand things grow larger and are zhen zhen. Westward it reaches Yi. Yi means all things have feathers and wings. Fourth month, the pitch pipe resonates with Zhong Lü. Zhong Lü means all things exhaust their journeys and travel west. Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to si. Si means yang qi has already been exhausted. Westward it reaches Seven Stars. Seven Stars means yang number completes at seven, therefore called Seven Stars. Westward it reaches Zhang. Zhang means all things are stretched out. Westward it reaches Zhu. Zhu means the beginning decline of things, yang qi pours down, therefore called Zhu. Fifth month, the pitch pipe resonates with Rui Bin. Rui Bin means yin qi is young and few, therefore called Rui; yang is withered and does not function, therefore called Bin.

sentences.zh: 景風居南方。

translations.text: The Jing wind resides in the south.

sentences.zh: 景者，言陽氣道竟，故曰景風。

translations.text: Jing means yang qi reaches its limit, therefore called Jing wind.

sentences.zh: 其於十二子為午。

translations.text: Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to wu.

sentences.zh: 午者，陰陽交，故曰午。

translations.text: Wu means yin and yang intersect, therefore called wu.

sentences.zh: 其於十母為丙丁。

translations.text: Among the ten heavenly stems it corresponds to bing and ding.

sentences.zh: 丙者，言陽道著明，故曰丙；

translations.text: Bing means yang way becomes bright, therefore called bing;

sentences.zh: 丁者，言萬物之丁壯也，故曰丁。

translations.text: ding means the thriving strength of things, therefore called ding.

sentences.zh: 西至于弧。

translations.text: Westward it reaches Hu.

sentences.zh: 弧者，言萬物之吳落且就死也。

translations.text: Hu means things wither and fall, approaching death.

sentences.zh: 西至于狼。

translations.text: Westward it reaches Lang.

sentences.zh: 狼者，言萬物可度量，斷萬物，故曰狼。

translations.text: Lang means things can be measured, cutting things, therefore called Lang.

The Jing wind resides in the south. Jing means yang qi reaches its limit, therefore called Jing wind. Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to wu. Wu means yin and yang intersect, therefore called wu. Among the ten heavenly stems it corresponds to bing and ding. Bing means yang way becomes bright, therefore called bing; ding means the thriving strength of things, therefore called ding. Westward it reaches Hu. Hu means things wither and fall, approaching death. Westward it reaches Lang. Lang means things can be measured, cutting things, therefore called Lang.

sentences.zh: 涼風居西南維，主地。

translations.text: The Liang wind resides in the southwest corner, governs earth.

sentences.zh: 地者，沈奪萬物氣也。

translations.text: Earth means it sinks and seizes the qi of things.

sentences.zh: 六月也，律中林鐘。

translations.text: Sixth month, the pitch pipe resonates with Lin Zhong.

sentences.zh: 林鐘者，言萬物就死氣林林然。

translations.text: Lin Zhong means things approach death, qi lin lin.

sentences.zh: 其於十二子為未。

translations.text: Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to wei.

sentences.zh: 未者，言萬物皆成，有滋味也。

translations.text: Wei means all things are complete, have flavors.

sentences.zh: 北至於罰。

translations.text: Northward it reaches Fa.

sentences.zh: 罰者，言萬物氣奪可伐也。

translations.text: Fa means the qi of things can be attacked.

sentences.zh: 北至於參。

translations.text: Northward it reaches Shen.

sentences.zh: 參言萬物可參也，故曰參。

translations.text: Shen means things can be examined, therefore called Shen.

sentences.zh: 七月也，律中夷則。

translations.text: Seventh month, the pitch pipe resonates with Yi Ze.

sentences.zh: 夷則，言陰氣之賊萬物也。

translations.text: Yi Ze means yin qi harms things.

sentences.zh: 其於十二子為申。

translations.text: Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to shen.

sentences.zh: 申者，言陰用事，申賊萬物，故曰申。

translations.text: Shen means yin functions, shen harms things, therefore called shen.

sentences.zh: 北至於濁。

translations.text: Northward it reaches Zhuo.

sentences.zh: 濁者，觸也，言萬物皆觸死也，故曰濁。

translations.text: Zhuo means 'to touch', saying all things touch death, therefore called Zhuo.

sentences.zh: 北至於留。

translations.text: Northward it reaches Liu.

sentences.zh: 留者，言陽氣之稽留也，故曰留。

translations.text: Liu means yang qi stays behind, therefore called Liu.

sentences.zh: 八月也，律中南呂。

translations.text: Eighth month, the pitch pipe resonates with Nan Lü.

sentences.zh: 南呂者，言陽氣之旅入藏也。

translations.text: Nan Lü means yang qi travels and enters storage.

sentences.zh: 其於十二子為酉。

translations.text: Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to you.

sentences.zh: 酉者，萬物之老也，故曰酉。

translations.text: You means the aging of things, therefore called you.

The Liang wind resides in the southwest corner, governs earth. Earth means it sinks and seizes the qi of things. Sixth month, the pitch pipe resonates with Lin Zhong. Lin Zhong means things approach death, qi lin lin. Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to wei. Wei means all things are complete, have flavors. Northward it reaches Fa. Fa means the qi of things can be attacked. Northward it reaches Shen. Shen means things can be examined, therefore called Shen. Seventh month, the pitch pipe resonates with Yi Ze. Yi Ze means yin qi harms things. Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to shen. Shen means yin functions, shen harms things, therefore called shen. Northward it reaches Zhuo. Zhuo means 'to touch', saying all things touch death, therefore called Zhuo. Northward it reaches Liu. Liu means yang qi stays behind, therefore called Liu. Eighth month, the pitch pipe resonates with Nan Lü. Nan Lü means yang qi travels and enters storage. Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to you. You means the aging of things, therefore called you.

sentences.zh: 閶闔風居西方。

translations.text: The Changhe wind resides in the west.

sentences.zh: 閶者，倡也；

translations.text: Chang means 'to initiate';

sentences.zh: 闔者，藏也。

translations.text: he means 'to store'.

sentences.zh: 言陽氣道萬物，闔黃泉也。

translations.text: It says yang qi guides things, he into the yellow springs.

sentences.zh: 其於十母為庚辛。

translations.text: Among the ten heavenly stems it corresponds to geng and xin.

sentences.zh: 庚者，言陰氣庚萬物，故曰庚；

translations.text: Geng means yin qi geng harms things, therefore called geng;

sentences.zh: 辛者，言萬物之辛生，故曰辛。

translations.text: xin means the xin birth of things, therefore called xin.

sentences.zh: 北至於胃。

translations.text: Northward it reaches Wei.

sentences.zh: 胃者，言陽氣就藏，皆胃胃也。

translations.text: Wei means yang qi approaches storage, all wei wei.

sentences.zh: 北至於婁。

translations.text: Northward it reaches Lou.

sentences.zh: 婁者，呼萬物且內之也。

translations.text: Lou means calling things to enter them.

sentences.zh: 北至於奎。

translations.text: Northward it reaches Kui.

sentences.zh: 奎者，主毒螫殺萬物也，奎而藏之。

translations.text: Kui means governs poisonous stings killing things, Kui and store them.

sentences.zh: 九月也，律中無射。

translations.text: Ninth month, the pitch pipe resonates with Wu She.

sentences.zh: 無射者，陰氣盛用事，陽氣無餘也，故曰無射。

translations.text: Wu She means yin qi is strong and functions, yang qi has no remainder, therefore called Wu She.

sentences.zh: 其於十二子為戌。

translations.text: Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to xu.

sentences.zh: 戌者，言萬物盡滅，故曰戌。

translations.text: Xu means all things are extinguished, therefore called xu.

The Changhe wind resides in the west. Chang means 'to initiate'; he means 'to store'. It says yang qi guides things, he into the yellow springs. Among the ten heavenly stems it corresponds to geng and xin. Geng means yin qi geng harms things, therefore called geng; xin means the xin birth of things, therefore called xin. Northward it reaches Wei. Wei means yang qi approaches storage, all wei wei. Northward it reaches Lou. Lou means calling things to enter them. Northward it reaches Kui. Kui means governs poisonous stings killing things, Kui and store them. Ninth month, the pitch pipe resonates with Wu She. Wu She means yin qi is strong and functions, yang qi has no remainder, therefore called Wu She. Among the twelve earthly branches it corresponds to xu. Xu means all things are extinguished, therefore called xu.

sentences.zh: 律數：九九八十一以為宮。

translations.text: Pitch pipe numbers: nine times nine eighty-one as gong.

sentences.zh: 三分去一，五十四以為徵。

translations.text: Subtract one third, fifty-four as zhi.

sentences.zh: 三分益一，七十二以為商。

translations.text: Add one third, seventy-two as shang.

sentences.zh: 三分去一，四十八以為羽。

translations.text: Subtract one third, forty-eight as yu.

sentences.zh: 三分益一，六十四以為角。

translations.text: Add one third, sixty-four as jiao.

sentences.zh: 黃鐘長八寸七分一，宮。

translations.text: Huangzhong length eight inches seven tenths one, gong.

sentences.zh: 大呂長七寸五分三分（一）［二］。

translations.text: Dalü length seven inches five tenths three over two.

sentences.zh: 太蔟長七寸（七）［十］分二，角。

translations.text: Taicu length seven inches ten tenths two, jiao.

sentences.zh: 夾鐘長六寸（一）［七］分三分一。

translations.text: Jiazhong length six inches seven tenths three over one.

sentences.zh: 姑洗長六寸（七）［十］分四，羽。

translations.text: Guxi length six inches ten tenths four, yu.

sentences.zh: 仲呂長五寸九分三分二，徵。

translations.text: Zhonglü length five inches nine tenths three over two, zhi.

sentences.zh: 蕤賓長五寸六分三分（一）［二］。

translations.text: Ruibin length five inches six tenths three over two.

sentences.zh: 林鐘長五寸（七）［十］分四，角。

translations.text: Linzhong length five inches ten tenths four, jiao.

sentences.zh: 夷則長五寸［四分］三分二，商。

translations.text: Yize length five inches four tenths three over two, shang.

sentences.zh: 南呂長四寸（七）［十］分八，徵。

translations.text: Nanlü length four inches ten tenths eight, zhi.

sentences.zh: 無射長四寸四分三分二。

translations.text: Wushe length four inches four tenths three over two.

sentences.zh: 應鐘長四寸二分三分二，羽。

translations.text: Yingzhong length four inches two tenths three over two, yu.

Pitch pipe numbers: nine times nine eighty-one as gong. Subtract one third, fifty-four as zhi. Add one third, seventy-two as shang. Subtract one third, forty-eight as yu. Add one third, sixty-four as jiao. Huangzhong length eight inches seven tenths one, gong. Dalü length seven inches five tenths three over two. Taicu length seven inches ten tenths two, jiao. Jiazhong length six inches seven tenths three over one. Guxi length six inches ten tenths four, yu. Zhonglü length five inches nine tenths three over two, zhi. Ruibin length five inches six tenths three over two. Linzhong length five inches ten tenths four, jiao. Yize length five inches four tenths three over two, shang. Nanlü length four inches ten tenths eight, zhi. Wushe length four inches four tenths three over two. Yingzhong length four inches two tenths three over two, yu.

sentences.zh: 生鐘分：子一分。

translations.text: Born pitch pipes division: zi one part.

sentences.zh: 丑三分二。

translations.text: Chou three over two.

sentences.zh: 寅九分八。

translations.text: Yin nine over eight.

sentences.zh: 卯二十七分十六。

translations.text: Mao twenty-seven over sixteen.

sentences.zh: 辰八十一分六十四。

translations.text: Chen eighty-one over sixty-four.

sentences.zh: 巳二百四十三分一百二十八。

translations.text: Si two hundred forty-three over one hundred twenty-eight.

sentences.zh: 午七百二十九分五百一十二。

translations.text: Wu seven hundred twenty-nine over five hundred twelve.

sentences.zh: 未二千一百八十七分一千二十四。

translations.text: Wei two thousand one hundred eighty-seven over one thousand twenty-four.

sentences.zh: 申六千五百六十一分四千九十六。

translations.text: Shen six thousand five hundred sixty-one over four thousand ninety-six.

sentences.zh: 酉一萬九千六百八十三分八千一百九十二。

translations.text: You nineteen thousand six hundred eighty-three over eight thousand one hundred ninety-two.

sentences.zh: 戌五萬九千四十九分三萬二千七百六十八。

translations.text: Xu fifty-nine thousand forty-nine over thirty-two thousand seven hundred sixty-eight.

sentences.zh: 亥十七萬七千一百四十七分六萬五千五百三十六。

translations.text: Hai one hundred seventy-seven thousand one hundred forty-seven over sixty-five thousand five hundred thirty-six.

Born pitch pipes division: zi one part. Chou three over two. Yin nine over eight. Mao twenty-seven over sixteen. Chen eighty-one over sixty-four. Si two hundred forty-three over one hundred twenty-eight. Wu seven hundred twenty-nine over five hundred twelve. Wei two thousand one hundred eighty-seven over one thousand twenty-four. Shen six thousand five hundred sixty-one over four thousand ninety-six. You nineteen thousand six hundred eighty-three over eight thousand one hundred ninety-two. Xu fifty-nine thousand forty-nine over thirty-two thousand seven hundred sixty-eight. Hai one hundred seventy-seven thousand one hundred forty-seven over sixty-five thousand five hundred thirty-six.

sentences.zh: 生黃鐘術曰：以下生者，倍其實，三其法。

translations.text: Method for generating Huangzhong: for downward generation, double the actual, triple the denominator.

sentences.zh: 以上生者，四其實，三其法。

translations.text: For upward generation, quadruple the actual, triple the denominator.

sentences.zh: 上九，商八，羽七，角六，宮五，徵九。

translations.text: Above nine, shang eight, yu seven, jiao six, gong five, zhi nine.

sentences.zh: 置一而九三之以為法。

translations.text: Set one and multiply by nine, divide by three to make the denominator.

sentences.zh: 實如法，得長一寸。

translations.text: Actual equals denominator, gets length one inch.

sentences.zh: 凡得九寸，命曰「黃鐘之宮」。

translations.text: Altogether gets nine inches, named 'Huangzhong gong'.

sentences.zh: 故曰音始於宮，窮於角；

translations.text: Therefore it is said sound begins with gong, ends with jiao;

sentences.zh: 數始於一，終於十，成於三；

translations.text: numbers begin with one, end with ten, complete with three;

sentences.zh: 氣始於冬至，周而復生。

translations.text: qi begins with winter solstice, cycles and is reborn.

Method for generating Huangzhong: for downward generation, double the actual, triple the denominator. For upward generation, quadruple the actual, triple the denominator. Above nine, shang eight, yu seven, jiao six, gong five, zhi nine. Set one and multiply by nine, divide by three to make the denominator. Actual equals denominator, gets length one inch. Altogether gets nine inches, named 'Huangzhong gong'. Therefore it is said sound begins with gong, ends with jiao; numbers begin with one, end with ten, complete with three; qi begins with winter solstice, cycles and is reborn.

sentences.zh: 神生於無，形成於有，形然後數，形而成聲，故曰神使氣，氣就形。

translations.text: Spirit is born from nothing, forms from having, form then number, form then sound, therefore spirit makes qi, qi approaches form.

sentences.zh: 形理如類有可類。

translations.text: Form principle has similarities that can be categorized.

sentences.zh: 或未形而未類，或同形而同類，類而可班，類而可識。

translations.text: Some are not formed and cannot be categorized, some are same form and same category, categorized and can be ranked, categorized and can be known.

sentences.zh: 聖人知天地識之別，故從有以至未有，以得細若氣，微若聲。

translations.text: Sages know the distinctions of heaven and earth, therefore follow from having to reach not having, thus obtaining fine as qi, subtle as sound.

sentences.zh: 然聖人因神而存之，雖妙必效情，核其華道者明矣。

translations.text: Yet sages rely on spirit to preserve it, though wondrous it must respond to feelings, examining its flowery way is clear.

sentences.zh: 非有聖心以乘聰明，孰能存天地之神而成形之情哉？

translations.text: Without sage heart riding intelligence, who can preserve heaven and earth's spirit and complete form's feelings?

sentences.zh: 神者，物受之而不能知（及）其去來，故聖人畏而欲存之。

translations.text: Spirit is what things receive but cannot know its comings and goings, therefore sages fear it and wish to preserve it.

sentences.zh: 唯欲存之，神之亦存。

translations.text: Only wishing to preserve it, the spirit also preserves.

sentences.zh: 其欲存之者，故莫貴焉。

translations.text: Those who wish to preserve it, therefore nothing is more precious.

Spirit is born from nothing, forms from having, form then number, form then sound, therefore spirit makes qi, qi approaches form. Form principle has similarities that can be categorized. Some are not formed and cannot be categorized, some are same form and same category, categorized and can be ranked, categorized and can be known. Sages know the distinctions of heaven and earth, therefore follow from having to reach not having, thus obtaining fine as qi, subtle as sound. Yet sages rely on spirit to preserve it, though wondrous it must respond to feelings, examining its flowery way is clear. Without sage heart riding intelligence, who can preserve heaven and earth's spirit and complete form's feelings? Spirit is what things receive but cannot know its comings and goings, therefore sages fear it and wish to preserve it. Only wishing to preserve it, the spirit also preserves. Those who wish to preserve it, therefore nothing is more precious.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：（故）［在］旋璣玉衡以齊七政，即天地二十八宿。

translations.text: The Grand Historian says: Aligning the whirling jade and balance to regulate the seven governances, then heaven's twenty-eight lodges.

sentences.zh: 十母，十二子，鐘律調自上古。

translations.text: Ten heavenly stems, twelve earthly branches, pitch pipes and calendars established from high antiquity.

sentences.zh: 建律運歷造日度，可據而度也。

translations.text: Establish pitch pipes, operate calendar, create day degrees, can be relied upon to measure.

sentences.zh: 合符節，通道德，即從斯之謂也。

translations.text: Unite tallies and seals, penetrate morality and virtue, then this is what it means.

The Grand Historian says: Aligning the whirling jade and balance to regulate the seven governances, then heaven's twenty-eight lodges. Ten heavenly stems, twelve earthly branches, pitch pipes and calendars established from high antiquity. Establish pitch pipes, operate calendar, create day degrees, can be relied upon to measure. Unite tallies and seals, penetrate morality and virtue, then this is what it means.
